intro: Gynopleura dilatata, commonly known as the broadleaf gynopleura, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that split open to release seeds. Gynopleura dilatata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
